text: Cedar Lane, also known as Fountain House, is a historic plantation house located near Leggett, Edgecombe County, North Carolina. It was built in the late-1840s, and is a two-story, double-pile, three bays wide, vernacular Greek Revival style frame dwelling. Also on the property are the contributing cook's house, dairy and electric plant, a smokehouse, tool shed, barn, and carriage house. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. ==References== Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Greek Revival houses in North Carolina Category:Houses in Edgecombe County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Edgecombe County, North Carolina
title: Cedar Lane
